Mark Jones
Osceola Youth Center
3030 Long Lane Rd,
Evart, MI, 49639
Re: License #: CI670414130

Dear Mr. Jones:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-
6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2024SIC0001561
Special Investigation Intake Date: July 5, 2024
License #: CI670414130

Capacity: 16

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 7/4/24, two youth at the facility were in a verbal altercation and
a staff member took one youth outside to calm them down. The
staff member body slammed the youth to the ground face first.
Youth bit the staff member. Youth's face is swollen and hurts from
hitting the ground. Youth does not want to be on the unit with this
staff member.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed on July 10, 2024, and reported
they did not have an additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July 9,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A presented
for the interview with scratches on the left side of her face by her
eye. Youth A said the scratches were from Staff 1 “tackling” her to
the ground. Youth A said she was outside arguing with Youth B
and throwing rocks. Youth A said Staff 1 came running out of the
building yelling at her “for no reason” then stated it was actually
because she was throwing rocks. Youth A said Staff 1 got in her
face and said, “pick up rocks and see what happens”. Youth A said
she punched Staff 1, he “tackled” her to the ground and hit her
face on the ground which was how she got the scratches. Youth A
said once on the ground she turned and bit Staff 1 in the arm and
he got up and she was able to run inside and call Foster Care
Worker. Youth A denied Staff 1 restraining her or attempting to
restrain her, stating he was face-to-face with her, and restraints
are when staff are behind youth. Youth A said Youth B, Staff 2, and
Supervisor were all outside and saw the incident occur. Youth A
said she never had any issues with Staff 1 in the past however
was aware of Staff 1 “throwing another youth on the ground”
2

[SI2024SIC0001540]. Youth A said Staff 1 has not worked with her
since this incident.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July 9,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B said she
“got into it” with Youth A on Thursday, they were outside, and
Youth A was throwing rocks at her. Youth B said Staff 1 came
outside and aggressively walked up to Youth A and was standing
face to face with her yelling at her. Youth B said Youth A punched
Staff 1 and he “took her to the ground” and Youth A hit her face on
the ground. Youth B said she does not know if Staff 1 was
attempting to place Youth A in a restraint but stated his actions
were “aggressive”. Youth B said Youth A then bit Staff 1 and he got
up and walked away and Supervisor took over talking with Youth
A. Youth B said Staff 2 and Supervisor were present and saw the
incident occur. Youth B said Youth A called the police and they
came out and talked to Youth A as well. Youth B said Staff 1 has
never been aggressive towards her. Youth B said she saw Staff 1
being aggressive with another peer [SIR2024SIC0001540] but is
not aware of any other issues with Staff 1.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July 9,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 said he is
currently a youth specialist and primarily works on Oak unit with
detention youth. Staff 1 said he heard a staff assistance call over
the radio however was not able to respond at first since he was
the only staff on his unit. Staff 1 said Nurse came into his unit and
asked he go outside to help Supervisor and Staff 2 while she
supervised the detention youth. Staff 1 said when he walked out
Staff 2 was attempting to deescalate Youth A. Staff 1 said Staff 2
is a very new staff, so he took over for her and she went back to
the unit with some of the other shelter youth. Staff 1 said Youth A
said “I’m gonna beat that bitch’s ass” and he responded “No” and
stood facing her blocking her from getting to Youth B. Staff 1 said
Youth A pushed him and then punched him in the face and
knocked his glasses off. Staff 1 said as soon at Youth A’s fist made
contact with his face, he took her arm and initiated a restraint
however he was not able to get her other arm before they tripped
over each other and went to the ground. Staff 1 said he is unsure
of exactly what made them trip other than their legs being tangled
up. Staff 1 said he landed on his right shoulder and knee and
Youth A was on the left side of her body. Staff 1 said he began to
stand back up and had reached out to help Youth A up and she bit
his right shoulder, breaking the skin, so he released her hand and
stepped back. Staff 1 said Youth A said she wanted to press
charges and walked back to her unit. Staff 1 said he walked over
3

to where Supervisor and Youth B were outside sitting and
switched with Supervisor. Staff 1 said Supervisor followed Youth A
and he supervised Youth B and eventually went back to the
detention unit. Staff 1 said he did not see any injury on Youth A
after the incident and he has not seen her since. Staff 1 denied
ever intentionally slammed or taking Youth A to the ground.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July 9,
2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 2 has
been employed since June 10, 2024, and primarily works second
shift on Willow unit with the shelter youth. Staff 2 said Youth A and
Youth B were arguing on the unit, so Supervisor took Youth A
outside, and Youth B ran after them. Staff 2 said she called for
assistance and Nurse came to the unit to watch the other youth
and she went outside. Staff 2 said Youth A was walking around
picking up rocks and throwing them towards Youth B. Staff 2 said
Staff 1 came outside and swapped her out so she could go back
on her unit. Staff 2 said she watched from the doorway, stating
Staff 1 approached Youth A loud and aggressively which escalated
the situation. Staff 2 said once Staff 1 was close to Youth A, she
pushed him causing his glasses to go up and fall off his face. Staff
2 said Staff 1 then initiated a restraint with Youth A and they fell to
the ground. Staff 2 said she is not sure exactly who or how they
fell but that Youth A hit the ground “pretty hard”. Staff 2 said Youth
A bit Staff 1 and he stood up very quickly. Staff 2 said Supervisor
and Youth B were also outside and saw the incident occur. Staff 2
said she did not see Staff 1 “slam” Youth A to the ground.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July
9, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Supervisor said
he has been employed for about four weeks as a supervisor.
Supervisor said Youth A and Youth B were arguing over the
remote on the unit when Youth A walked outside, and he followed
her. Supervisor said Youth B then also walked off the unit following
Youth A continuing to argue. Supervisor said Nurse went to the
unit with the other girls and Staff 2 came outside to assist
Supervisor with Youth A and Youth B. Supervisor said Youth A was
throwing rocks at staff and yelling. Supervisor said Staff 1 came
running out of the building and got “in [Youth A]’s face” daring her
to pick up rocks making the statement “you think you’re tough”.
Supervisor said Staff 1 then attempted a restraint and fell to the
ground with Youth A landing with Youth A face down on the ground
and Staff 1 on top of her back. Supervisor said he had a “side
view” from about “5 to 10 yards” away. Supervisor said it looked
like Staff 1 threw Youth A to the ground from his perspective
however Staff 1 reported to him that Youth A had dropped her
4

weight and he lost footing and they fell. Supervisor said as Staff 1
tried to get up Youth A bit him on the shoulder. Supervisor said
Youth A stood up and ran into the unit and Staff 1 switched with
him so he could follow Youth A while Staff 1 took over supervision
of Youth B. Supervisor said once on the unit Youth A said she
wanted to call her worker and while on the phone with her worker
reported Staff 1 had thrown her to the ground. Supervisor said
Youth A was then seen by Nurse as she has scratches on the side
of her face. Supervisor said he never saw Youth A push or hit Staff
1 or Staff 1 lose his glasses.
Nurse was interviewed via telephone on July 10, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Nurse said she was working
on Thursday and was outside when Youth A and Youth B came
outside arguing. Nurse said Supervisor and Staff 2 came out of
Willow unit and so she went onto the unit where there was one
youth and brought her outside to the side of the parking lot where
Supervisor could see her and went into Oak unit so Staff 1 could
respond to the situation. Nurse said she was not outside to see
the interactions between Staff 1 and Youth A. Nurse said after the
incident she did a medical exam of Youth A. Nurse said Youth A
had scratches on the left side of her face near her eye that looked
like “road rash”. Nurse said Youth A reported the wound did not
hurt, she did not have any other injuries, and refused Tylenol.
Nurse said she cleaned the wound and applied antibiotic ointment.
Nurse denied Youth A making any statements about how she
obtained the injury.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was discipline for work
tardiness, and Staff 1 completed his SCM training on
October 25, 2023, through October 27, 2023.
• Pictures of Youth A’s face dated July 5, 2024, were viewed.
Youth A had many scratches by her eye on the right side of
her face.
• Osceola Youth Center medical report dated July 4, 2024,
was reviewed. The form was signed by Nurse and stated
“youth has superficial abrasions on her right cheek by her
eye. Youth states no physical pain at this time.”
• Osceola Youth Center Incident Reports dated July 4, 2024,
were reviewed. There were two incident reports, one
authored by Staff 1 that was consistent with his interview,
the second authored by Supervisor and was consistent with
his interview.
• Osceola County Sheriff’s Police Report number 67-2401114
dated July 4, 2024, was reviewed. The police report
5

included statements from Youth A, Staff 1, and Supervisor.
Youth A’s statement was consistent with her interview. Staff
1’s statement was consistent with his interview.
Supervisor’s statement reported “[Staff 1] attempted to
place [Youth A] in a restraint hold but ended up “body
slamming” her. [Supervisor] stated he was not sure if it was
intentional or not.”
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as there was not enough
information to support a rule violation. There was no video review.
Youth A reported she was “tackled” by Staff 1, however Youth B,
Staff 2, and Supervisor report that Staff 1 may have been
attempting a restraint however it was unclear, and Staff 1 reports
he was attempting to restrain Youth A and they fell to the ground.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’
needs, implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of
residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 7/4/24, a staff member followed youth outside and taunted and
instigated the youth which escalated the youth further. Staff
member has called youth names.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed on July 10, 2024, and reported
they did not have an additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July 9,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A said she
was outside arguing with Youth B and throwing rocks. Youth A said
Staff 1 came running out of the building yelling at her “for no
reason” then stated it was actually because she was throwing
rocks. Youth A said Staff 1 got in her face and said, “pick up rocks
6

and see what happens”. Youth A said Staff 1 made her more upset
and she pushed him. Youth A denied Staff 1 calling her names.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July 9,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B said Staff 1
came outside and aggressively walked up to Youth A and was
standing face to face with her yelling at her. Youth B said Staff 1
made the situation “worse” when he came outside.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July 9,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 said he only
took over for Staff 2 due to her being so new. Staff 1 said Youth A
was making threats and he just responded with “no” and stood
face-to-face with her to block her from throwing rocks at the other
youth and staff.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July 9,
2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 2 said she
felt Supervisor should have stepped in to stop Staff 1 as he was
approaching Youth A due to the aggressive nature in which he
was acting towards Youth A as he walked up to her. Staff 2 said
Staff 1’s intervention escalated Youth A and made the situation
escalate.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July
9, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Supervisor said
Staff 1 “definitely escalated the situation” when he came out of the
building and interacted with Youth A. Supervisor said he talked to
Staff 1 and told him he should not approach youth the way he did
when they are upset as it further escalates the situation.
On July 24, 2024, Director reported staff are all clearly trained in
de-escalation through their SCM training. Director said staff are
presented with at least twenty strategies and skills to draw from to
de-escalate a youth.
On July 24, 2024, Trainer reported staff are trained to use the
least restrictive alternative which includes verbal de-escalation
skills and motivational interviews which assists them in
interactions with youth in crisis.
Documents Reviewed:
• Osceola County Sheriff’s Police Report number 67-2401114
dated July 4, 2024, was reviewed. The police report
included statements from Youth A, Staff 1, and Supervisor.
Youth A’s statement was consistent with her interview. Staff
7

1’s statement was consistent with his interview.
Supervisor’s statement reported “[Staff 1] came out and
was hostile towards [Youth A] and did not attempt to
deescalate.”
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was discipline for work
tardiness, and Staff 1 completed his SCM training on
October 25, 2023, through October 27, 2023.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as Youth A, Youth B, Staff
2, and Supervisor all noted Staff 1 escalated the situation when he
arrived and did not use the techniques he is trained to use.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.

sir_summary.summary: The investigation found no definitive evidence that a staff member intentionally 'body-slammed' a youth during an altercation, as accounts differed on whether it was an attempted restraint that resulted in a fall. However, multiple witnesses, including other staff, confirmed that the staff member escalated the situation by approaching the youth in an aggressive manner and failing to use proper de-escalation techniques, which violated the facility's required policies and procedures. Therefore, while the facility was found compliant on the physical intervention allegation, it was found non-compliant for failing to follow its own program statement policies regarding care and supervision. The agency is culpable for a violation due to a staff member's inappropriate conduct that contravened established de-escalation protocols, necessitating a corrective action plan.
